channel.title: Update errors after disabling systemsplit and vpn install
channel.description:
In order to hide the obvious use of TOR from my isp after install i disable the system split and install VPN. but after i try to upgrade nonroot it spits out the following errors:
E: Release file for tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian/dists/bookworm-updates/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 3h 28min 51s). Updates for this repository will not be applied. E: Release file for tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian/dists/bookworm-backports/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 3h 28min 51s). Updates for this repository will not be applied. E: Release file for tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian-fasttrack/dists/bookworm-fasttrack/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 6h 48min 3s). Updates for this repository will not be applied. E: Release file for tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian-fasttrack/dists/bookworm-backports-staging/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 6h 48min 2s). Updates for this repository will not be applied. zsh: exit 100 sudo apt update
when i do sudo apt update and upgrade it upgrades about 250mb of data witholding what i assume is the files that fail with the nonroot method

item.title: Update errors after disabling systemsplit and vpn install
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Unrelated to user-sysmaint-split.

Highly unlikely related to user-sysmaint-split, which does not touch APT / sources list configurations / clock.

farukar:

InRelease is not valid yet

See:
InRelease is not valid yet error

Read full topic
item.source: Update errors after disabling systemsplit and vpn install

item.title: Update errors after disabling systemsplit and vpn install
item.dc:creator: farukar
item.description:
In order to hide the obvious use of TOR from my isp after install i disable the system split and install VPN.
but after i try to upgrade nonroot it spits out the following errors:

E: Release file for tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian/dists/bookworm-updates/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 3h 28min 51s). Updates for this repository will not be applied.
E: Release file for tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian/dists/bookworm-backports/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 3h 28min 51s). Updates for this repository will not be applied.
E: Release file for tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian-fasttrack/dists/bookworm-fasttrack/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 6h 48min 3s). Updates for this repository will not be applied.
E: Release file for tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian-fasttrack/dists/bookworm-backports-staging/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 6h 48min 2s). Updates for this repository will not be applied.
zsh: exit 100 sudo apt update

when i do sudo apt update and upgrade it upgrades about 250mb of data witholding what i assume is the files that fail with the nonroot method
